questions.question: I can't get used to ……………………… in the country.
questions.description: We use an ing form after get used to.

questions.question: I saw him ……………………….. it.
questions.description: See can be followed by an ing form or an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I called him before …………………….. out.
questions.description: After some conjunctions, the ing form can be used instead of a clause.

questions.question: I want you …………………….. for me.
She wanted me ………………….. it before I left.
I used ……………………… football when I was young.
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after used.

questions.question: I was delighted to find her …………………….. so happy.
Remind me ………………………. the money.
You must not forget ………………….. her tomorrow.
questions.description: Forget is followed by a to-infinitive when the reference is to future.

questions.question: It is no good …………………… to him. He won't help.
questions.description: We use an ing form after it is no good.

questions.question: I would like ……………….. that movie again.
questions.description: Would like is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: She wanted me …………………. with her.
questions.description: Want is followed by object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: I dislike people ………………………… me what to do.
questions.description: Dislike is usually followed by object + ing form.

questions.question: I don’t think that his books deserve …………………………
questions.description: After deserve the –ing form has a passive meaning. We can also express this idea with a passive infinitive: I don’t think that his books deserve to be read.

questions.question: Nobody can stop him from ……………………………. what he wants.
questions.description: The verb stop is followed by object + from + ing form.

questions.question: She prevented me from ……………………….. her room.
questions.description: The verb prevent is followed by object + from + ing form.

questions.question: She didn’t want me ………………………..
questions.description: The verb want is followed by object + infinitive.

questions.question: The doctor suggested ………………………….. a long holiday.
questions.description: The verb suggest cannot be followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: Byron woke up one day ………………………… himself famous.
questions.description: We often use infinitive clauses to say what somebody found out at the end of a task.

questions.question: The plants need …………………………
questions.description: The ing form has a passive meaning after the verb need. The same idea can be expressed with a passive infinitive: The plants need to be pruned.

questions.question: She burst out ………………………. when she saw him.
questions.description: The verb burst out is usually followed by –ing forms.

questions.question: I don’t mind ……………………….. care of young babies.
questions.description: Mind is usually followed by an –ing form.

questions.question: She is very good ………………………….problems.
questions.description: Many adjectives are followed by preposition + ing form. Good is one of them.

questions.question: We have a good chance …………………………..
questions.description: After some nouns we can use either an ing form or an infinitive with little difference of meaning. Chance is one of them.
